title: What is Pitagora's philosophy on the essence of nature and human suffering, and how can one achieve spiritual liberation?
first_phrase: In the last 200 tokens of this text, the author delves deeper into the concept of divine immortal beings and the hierarchy of power and dignity that they possess. The text mentions the idea of suffering and how few can attain liberation from it. The author urges the readers to open their minds and seek knowledge to avoid being trapped in an unending cycle of misery. The mention of Pitagora and his teachings on the harmony of different cults is also made. The essence of the text is to inspire readers to strive for spiritual fulfilment and achieve a state of immortality beyond physical limitations.

last_phrase: In conclusion, let us leave behind the mentioned foods and focus on purifying and freeing our souls, observing and evaluating everything with the guidance of our higher intellect. By doing so, we can attain immortality and be less vulnerable. Let us honor and venerate the celestial intelligences, similar to the way Pythagoras respected local beliefs, and approach them with filial reverence to enhance our spiritual progress.
